analyzed: shing zad pa'i me bzhin du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las @111a *// 'das so // de'i sku gdung rgyal po kri kris spos kyi shing thams cad spungs te /
translated: he passed into parinirvana in the realm of nirvana without the aggregates remaining, like a fire when the wood is exhausted.🔽His remains were collected in a pile by King Kriki,

original: spungs pas bsregs nas me'o mas bsad de /
analyzed: spungs pas bsregs nas me'o mas bsad de /
translated: who cremated them in a pyre of all kinds of fragrant woods.

original: sku gdung de dag ni rin po che sna bzhi las byas pa'i bum pa'i nang du blugs nas /
analyzed: sku gdung de dag ni rin po che sna bzhi las byas pa'i bum pa'i nang du blugs nas /
translated: The remains were placed in a vase made of the four precious substances,🔽and

original: sa phyogs dben zhing yangs par sku gdung gi mchod rten 'phang du dpag tshad gcig la rgyar dpag tshad phyed pa zhig brtsig tu bcug go /
analyzed: sa phyogs dben zhing yangs par sku gdung gi mchod rten 'phang du dpag tshad gcig la rgyar dpag tshad phyed pa zhig brtsig tu bcug go /
translated: In an isolated and spacious place, he had a stūpa built for the relics, one yojana high and half a yojana wide.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na w'a ra n'a si na khyim bdag phyug pa nor mang ba longs spyod che ba yongs su bzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na w'a ra n'a si na khyim bdag phyug pa nor mang ba longs spyod che ba yongs su bzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
translated: At that time, in Vārāṇasī, there lived a householder who was rich and had great wealth and many possessions, with vast and abundant holdings, equal to Vaiśravaṇa’s wealth.

original: rnam thos kyi bu la nor gyis 'gran pa zhig gnas pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te /
analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu la nor gyis 'gran pa zhig gnas pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te /
translated: He was a rival of Vaiśravaṇa in wealth. He took a wife from a family of equal rank,

original: de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /🔽dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed / dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: and he enjoyed himself with her.🔽He took pleasure with her.

original: de rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: de rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: He made love with her.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa na rim gyis khye'u gsum btsas so //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa na rim gyis khye'u gsum btsas so //
translated: As he enjoyed himself, took pleasure, and made love, three sons were born in due course.

original: ci tsam na khyim bdag de nad kyis thebs nas /
analyzed: ci tsam na khyim bdag de nad kyis thebs nas /
translated: Then, the householder fell ill.

original: de rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma dang / 'bras bu'i sman rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byas kyang de'i nad zhi bar ma gyur nas de 'chi ba'i chos dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: de rtsa ba dang / sdong po dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma dang / 'bras bu'i sman rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byas kyang de'i nad zhi bar ma gyur nas de 'chi ba'i chos dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: He was treated with medicines from roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits, but his illness was not cured and he died.

original: de nas de bu rnams kyis ras sngon po dang / ser po dang dmar po dang dkar pos khyogs brgyan nas dur khrod du khyer te bsregs so //
analyzed: de nas de bu rnams kyis ras sngon po dang / ser po dang dmar po dang dkar pos khyogs brgyan nas dur khrod du khyer te bsregs so //
translated: Then his sons decorated a bier with blue, yellow, red, and white cloth and carried him to the charnel ground to burn him.

original: de nas pha la pha'i bya ba byas nas mya ngan sangs te /
analyzed: de nas pha la pha'i bya ba byas nas mya ngan sangs te /
translated: After they had performed the rites for their father, they were consoled.

original: de nas nor so so bgo bar gros bya bar brtsams nas /
analyzed: de nas nor so so bgo bar gros bya bar brtsams nas /
translated: Then they began to discuss how to divide the property.

original: phu bo shos kyis smras @111b pa; nor bgo'o //
analyzed: phu bo shos kyis smras @111b pa; nor bgo'o //
translated: The eldest brother said, “Let’s divide the property.”

original: nu bo spun gnyis ma dad do //
analyzed: nu bo spun gnyis ma dad do //
translated: The two younger brothers did not agree.

original: des gal gyis gcus pa dang / de gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: des gal gyis gcus pa dang / de gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: When he insisted, they said,

original: gal te de ltar na re zhig 'jig rten pha rol gyi lam rgyags blangs la phyis bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na re zhig 'jig rten pha rol gyi lam rgyags blangs la phyis bgo bar bya'o //
translated: “If it must be so, then first let’s take provisions for the road to the next world and then we’ll divide it.”

original: des smras pa ci dag bya /
analyzed: des smras pa ci dag bya /
translated: He asked, “What do we need?”

original: de gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis smras pa /
translated: The two said,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung 'di la mchod do //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung 'di la mchod do //
translated: We worship the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.”

original: de dad pa chung ba zhig pas des bka' 'khor du khas blangs so //
analyzed: de dad pa chung ba zhig pas des bka' 'khor du khas blangs so //
translated: Because he had little faith, he agreed to do it.

original: de nas de rnams kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung la mchod nas smon lam gdab par brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas de rnams kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung la mchod nas smon lam gdab par brtsams te /
translated: Then, after they had worshipped the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, they began to make aspirations.

original: gnyis kyis 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gnyis kyis 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Two of them said,🔽“By this root of virtue, may we two be the first disciples of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, the Blessed One,

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis bdag cag gnyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'od srung gis bram ze'i khye'u bla ma zhes bya ba la bram ze'i khye'u khyod skye dgu rnams kyi tshe lo brgya thub pa na /
translated: and may we be the last disciples of the Blessed One Śākyamuni.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pa gang yin pa de'i bstan pa la bdag cag rab tu byung nas khyad par thob par gyur cig ces btab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pa gang yin pa de'i bstan pa la bdag cag rab tu byung nas khyad par thob par gyur cig ces btab bo //
translated: He will be the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One named Śākyamuni.’ We pray that we may go forth in his teaching and attain distinction.”

original: de gnyis kyis smon lam btab pa /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis smon lam btab pa /
translated: Those two made their aspiration,

original: phu bo des thos nas drung du btud de /
analyzed: phu bo des thos nas drung du btud de /
translated: and when the elder heard that, he bowed down at their feet

original: smon lam gdab par brtsams pa /
analyzed: smon lam gdab par brtsams pa /
translated: and began to make his aspiration:

original: bdag ni dad pa chung la dmu rgod yin pas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis na bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa des cho 'phrul lnga brgyas btul nas rab tu phyung ste /
analyzed: bdag ni dad pa chung la dmu rgod yin pas dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis na bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa des cho 'phrul lnga brgyas btul nas rab tu phyung ste /
translated: “Because of this root of virtue, may I too be subdued by the Blessed One Śākyamuni with five hundred miracles, go forth,

original: rab tu byung nas kyang khyad par rtogs par gyur cig ces byas so //
analyzed: rab tu byung nas kyang khyad par rtogs par gyur cig ces byas so //
translated: and attain distinction after going forth.”

original: dge @112a *// slong dag ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge @112a *// slong dag ji snyam du sems /
translated: Monks, what do you think?

original: phu bo shos dmu rgod dad pa chung ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: phu bo shos dmu rgod dad pa chung ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The elder who was wild and had little faith

original: lteng rgyas 'od srung 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: lteng rgyas 'od srung 'di nyid yin no //
translated: is this very Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa.

original: nu bo gnyis po gang dag yin pa de dag ni chu klung 'od srung dang / ga ya 'od srung 'di dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: nu bo gnyis po gang dag yin pa de dag ni chu klung 'od srung dang / ga ya 'od srung 'di dag nyid yin no //
translated: The two younger brothers are these two, Aśvajit and Gayākāśyapa.

original: smon lam gyi dbang des na lteng rgyas 'od srung cho 'phrul lnga brgyas btul ba yin no //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang des na lteng rgyas 'od srung cho 'phrul lnga brgyas btul ba yin no //
translated: By the power of that prayer, Urubilvā Kāśyapa was converted by five hundred miracles.

original: chu klung 'od srung dang / ga ya 'od srung ni tshegs chung dus btul ba yin no //
analyzed: chu klung 'od srung dang / ga ya 'od srung ni tshegs chung dus btul ba yin no //
translated: Aśvajit and Gayākāśyapa were converted with little difficulty.

original: gang gi tshe rgyal po gzugs can snying po gzhon nur gyur pa de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab na khyim bdag cig yod pa de la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyal po gzugs can snying po gzhon nur gyur pa de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab na khyim bdag cig yod pa de la /
translated: When King Bimbisāra was a prince, there was a householder in Rājagṛha.

analyzed: kun dga'i ra ba me tog dang; 'bras bu dang / chu phun sum tshogs pa zhig yod de /
translated: He had a pleasure grove that was perfect with flowers, fruits, and water.

original: de de la lhag par chags par gyur to //
analyzed: de de la lhag par chags par gyur to //
translated: He became attached to it.

original: ji tsam na gzugs can snying po phyi rol tu byung bas skyed mos tshal de mthong ba dang / de yang lhag par chags par gyur nas smras pa /
analyzed: ji tsam na gzugs can snying po phyi rol tu byung bas skyed mos tshal de mthong ba dang / de yang lhag par chags par gyur nas smras pa /
translated: When Bimbisāra went out and saw that pleasure grove, he became attached to it and said,

analyzed: khyim bdag skyed mos tshal 'di nga la byin cig /
translated: “Householder, give me this pleasure grove.”🔽“Your Majesty, I cannot give it to you.”

original: des ma byin no //
analyzed: des ma byin no //
translated: “He did not give it.”

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du yang smras na yang ma byin nas /
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du yang smras na yang ma byin nas /
translated: He asked a second and a third time, but the answer was the same.

original: yang smras pa; rin sbyin no //🔽des smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa; rin sbyin no // des smras pa /
translated: “I will pay you for it.”

original: gzhon nu nyes na kho bo yul nas spyugs kyang bla'i skyed mos tshal ni mi 'bul lo //
analyzed: gzhon nu nyes na kho bo yul nas spyugs kyang bla'i skyed mos tshal ni mi 'bul lo //
translated: “Young man,” he replied, “I would rather be exiled from my country than not give you the park.”

original: gzhon nu gzugs can snying pos smras pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu gzugs can snying pos smras pa /
translated: Prince Bimbisāra said,

original: khyim bdag khyod kyis smras pa dran par byos shig /
analyzed: khyim bdag khyod kyis smras pa dran par byos shig /
translated: “Householder, remember what you said.

analyzed: nam nga rgyal por gyur pa de'i tshe nga nyid kyis bkur ro // des smras pa /
translated: When I become king, I will honor you.”

analyzed: nam khyod rgyal por gyur pa de'i tshe kho bo yang rgyal po'i khab nas 'gro'o //
translated: “When you become king,” he replied, “I will leave the capital.”

analyzed: gzhon nu @112b gzugs can snying pos 'jal to zhes byas nas song ngo //
translated: “Young man, I understand,” said Prince Bimbisāra, and he left.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na rgyal po padma chen po shi nas /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na rgyal po padma chen po shi nas /
translated: Later, when King Mahāpadma died,

analyzed: gzhon nu gzugs can snying po rgyal srid la bzhag pa dang / des skyed mos tshal de mthus phrogs so //
translated: Prince Bimbisāra was installed as king, and he took the park by force.

analyzed: khyim bdag de snying na zhing skyed mos tshal de la lhag par chags pas shi nas de nyid kyi sbrul gdug pa zhig tu skyes te /
translated: The householder was very attached to that park, and when he died he was reborn as a poisonous snake there.

original: de rgyal po la rgyun du glags tshol ba lhur len cing gnas so //
analyzed: de rgyal po la rgyun du glags tshol ba lhur len cing gnas so //
translated: He constantly sought an opportunity to harm the king.

analyzed: ji tsam na rgyal po gzugs can snying po so ga'i dus lab ste /
translated: One day King Bimbisāra went to the park in the spring.🔽The flowers on the trees had bloomed.

analyzed: me tog gi shing rnam kha 'bus pa na btsun mo dang lhan cig skyed mos tshal der zhugs nas /

analyzed: de de na skyes pa med par rol mos btsun mo'i bud med dang lhan cig dga' ba'i rtsed mo nyams su myong bar byas nas gnyid log go /
translated: They fell asleep.

original: bud med ni me tog dang 'bras bu la dga' ba yin pas kun tu 'khyam du dong ngo //🔽bud med gcig gi ral gri bskur te /
analyzed: bud med ni me tog dang 'bras bu la dga' ba yin pas kun tu 'khyam du dong ngo // bud med gcig gi ral gri bskur te /
translated: Women like flowers and fruit, so they went wandering around.

original: rgyal po srung du bcug go /
analyzed: rgyal po srung du bcug go /
translated: One woman was left to guard the king.

original: de nas sbrul gdug pa des rgyal po'i drung na sgra mi grag par rig nas rgyal po la gzung ba'i phyir tshang nas byung ste chas so //
analyzed: de nas sbrul gdug pa des rgyal po'i drung na sgra mi grag par rig nas rgyal po la gzung ba'i phyir tshang nas byung ste chas so //
translated: Then the poisonous snake, realizing that it was not making a sound in the presence of the king, came out of its nest in order to seize the king.

original: rgyal po'i bsod nams kyi mthus bya ka lan da ka zhes bya ba de rnams kyis sbrul gdug pa de kun nas bskor nas tsi tsi'i sgra phyung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po'i bsod nams kyi mthus bya ka lan da ka zhes bya ba de rnams kyis sbrul gdug pa de kun nas bskor nas tsi tsi'i sgra phyung ngo //
translated: By the power of the king's merit, the birds called kalandaka surrounded the poisonous snake and made the sound of a rat.

original: bud med ral gri thogs pas thos nas /
analyzed: bud med ral gri thogs pas thos nas /
translated: A woman with a sword heard that.

original: sdangs te sgra chen po phyung nas ral gris bsad do //
analyzed: sdangs te sgra chen po phyung nas ral gris bsad do //
translated: Terrified, she made a loud noise and killed it with her sword.

original: de nas rgyal po yang sdangs te sad nas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po yang sdangs te sad nas smras pa /
translated: Then the king woke up in fear and said,

original: 'di ci byung /
analyzed: 'di ci byung /
translated: What happened?

original: bud med des smras pa /
analyzed: bud med des smras pa /
translated: The woman said,

original: lha sbrul gdug pa 'di lha la gzung ba'i phyir chas pa na /
analyzed: lha sbrul gdug pa 'di lha la gzung ba'i phyir chas pa na /
translated: Deva, this poisonous snake was going to seize the Deva,

original: bya ka lan da ka rnams @113a *//
analyzed: bya ka lan da ka rnams @113a *//
translated: but the kalandaka birds

original: kyis tsi tsi'i sgra phyung nas bdag gis bkum lags so //
analyzed: kyis tsi tsi'i sgra phyung nas bdag gis bkum lags so //
translated: made the sound of a rat, and I killed it.

original: rgyal po'i gnas skabs de gzhon nu dang / blon po dang / khrom gyi ru ba dang / rgyal po'i khab na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs rnams kyis thos nas /
analyzed: rgyal po'i gnas skabs de gzhon nu dang / blon po dang / khrom gyi ru ba dang / rgyal po'i khab na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs rnams kyis thos nas /
translated: The king’s retinue, the young men, the ministers, the merchants, and the people of the capital heard about this.

original: skyed mos tshal de'i phyi nang du ku co'i sgra chen pos gang bar gyur te /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal de'i phyi nang du ku co'i sgra chen pos gang bar gyur te /
translated: The entire park was filled with the great sound of their wailing.

original: rgyal po de skye dgu la byams pa zhig pas /
analyzed: rgyal po de skye dgu la byams pa zhig pas /
translated: The king was kind to his people.

original: phyir zhing btsun mo skye bo'i tshogs dang bcas te mig mchi mas gang zhing 'khod do //
analyzed: phyir zhing btsun mo skye bo'i tshogs dang bcas te mig mchi mas gang zhing 'khod do //
translated: The queen and the people sat there, their eyes filled with tears.

original: de nas rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: Then the king said,

original: shes ldan dag rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba la srog skyob pa de la mchog ci sbyin /
analyzed: shes ldan dag rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba la srog skyob pa de la mchog ci sbyin /
translated: “Sirs, what reward should be given to the one who saves the life of a king, a kṣatriya anointed on the head?”

original: skye bo'i tshogs kyis smras pa /
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs kyis smras pa /
translated: The people said,

original: lha / rgyal srid kyi phyed do //
analyzed: lha / rgyal srid kyi phyed do //
translated: “Your Majesty, half the kingdom.”

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,

original: shes ldan dag bya ka lan da ka rnams kyis nga'i srog byin pas rgyal srid phyed 'di dag la byin no; ;blon po rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: shes ldan dag bya ka lan da ka rnams kyis nga'i srog byin pas rgyal srid phyed 'di dag la byin no; ;blon po rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: “Sirs, since the kalandakas saved my life, I give them half the kingdom.” The ministers said,🔽“Your Majesty, the kalandakas are birds.

analyzed: lha / bya 'di dag ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba lags pas /
translated: Your Majesty, these birds are born in the animal realm.

original: rgyal srid phyed kyi 'di dag la ci bgyi /
analyzed: rgyal srid phyed kyi 'di dag la ci bgyi /
translated: What will you do with half the kingdom?

original: 'di dag 'od ma'i tshal gang du gnas pa der 'di dag gi gnas bca'o //
analyzed: 'di dag 'od ma'i tshal gang du gnas pa der 'di dag gi gnas bca'o //
translated: In the Bamboo Grove where they live, make a home for them.”

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,

original: de bzhin du gyis shig /
analyzed: de bzhin du gyis shig /
translated: “Do it that way.”

original: skyed mos tshal de 'od ma'i tshal gyis yongs su bskor te /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal de 'od ma'i tshal gyis yongs su bskor te /
translated: The park was surrounded by bamboo.

analyzed: blon po rnams kyis de rnams kyi gnas 'od ma'i tshal gyi nye 'khor du bcas pas /
translated: The ministers made a home for them in the vicinity of the Bamboo Grove.

analyzed: de 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka gnas pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: That became known as the Bamboo Grove where the Kalandaka birds lived.

original: rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i zhang po kun tu 'tsho rnams kyi nang du rab tu byung nas /
analyzed: rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i zhang po kun tu 'tsho rnams kyi nang du rab tu byung nas /
translated: The king’s uncle, Pūrṇa, went forth among the Saṅgha of monks.

original: @113b des skyed mos tshal de de'i gnas kyi phyir byin no //
analyzed: @113b des skyed mos tshal de de'i gnas kyi phyir byin no //
translated: He gave the park to them as a home.

original: ji tsam na bcom ldan 'das ma ga dha nas ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa dang / rgyal po'i khab tu byon nas shing zhig gi drung na bzhugs so //

translated: “Householder, wherever there is a monastery, there the monks will come, go, and stay.”🔽“Blessed One, please come.

analyzed: khang brtsigs lags so //

translated: “Where is a place that is not too far from the city, not too near, with few people and little noise during the day, little sound at night, and where mosquitoes, flies, wind, sun, and snakes are few?”

analyzed: kyi phyir gtsug lag khang brtsigs na /

analyzed: mthong nas kyang 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: de nga'i yin no //

analyzed: bdag gis der bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir gtsug lag khang brtsig lags so //

analyzed: kun dga' ba ra ba ni khyim bdag gi yin no //

translated: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, having loaded many gold coins onto carts, wagons, and camels, and having brought them,

analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal thams cad @121a *//

analyzed: gshib par brtsams pa dang / sa phyogs 'ga' zhig ma yog pas ma bkram pa nyid du 'dug go /

analyzed: khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin ni gdon mi za bar ci'i phyir kun dga' ra ba'i ched du nor gyi phung po chen po 'di snyed du yongs su btang zhes 'gyod pa skyes so snyam du bsams nas khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la 'di skad ces smras
translated: Thinking this, he said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada,

analyzed: bdag gis ma bkram pa'i sa phyogs 'di bkram nas slar yang sba bar bya mi dgos pa'i gter ha cang nyung ba yang ma yin /

analyzed: ha cang mang po yang ma yin pa de gang yin snyam mo /

analyzed: kye ma sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mchog ma yin pa ma yin zhing /

analyzed: zhus pa de dag bdag la gsungs //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa // gang gis nga ni khyad gsod dang / gang zhig las ni 'jigs pa dang / gang las yid byung skyes pa dag /

analyzed: nyon cig khyod la bshad par bya //

original: rga dang na dang 'chi ba ste //
analyzed: rga dang na dang 'chi ba ste //

analyzed: yul rnams la ni @141b dga' bar 'gyur //

original: rgyal po zas gtsang gis gsol pa /

original: de nas rab dga' dad pa rgyas byas nas //
analyzed: de nas rab dga' dad pa rgyas byas nas //

analyzed: drang srong dge 'dun bskor ba byas nas ni //

analyzed: thub pa'i zhabs la mgo bos phyag byas te //

analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i chos bshad par mdzad de /

analyzed: lhas byin nga rgyal can las kyang nga rgyal can sdig pa 'dod pa des bden pa mthong bar ma byas pas //

analyzed: khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa dang bcas pas smras pa /

analyzed: bdag gis kyang 'jig rten thams cad dbang du bya ba zhig //

analyzed: ro hi ta ka'i skyed mos tshal du 'di lta bu'i chos bshad pa mdzad de /

original: de thos pas rgyal po zas gtsang ma gtogs par //
analyzed: de thos pas rgyal po zas gtsang ma gtogs par //

original: bdud rtsi zas la sogs pa sh'akya bdun khri lnga stong gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas pa na yang lhas sbyin dang de kho na bzhin du kha zer ro //
analyzed: bdud rtsi zas la sogs pa sh'akya bdun khri lnga stong gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas pa na yang lhas sbyin dang de kho na bzhin du kha zer ro //
translated: the seventy-five thousand Śākyas, including Amṛtodana, manifested the fruit of stream-entry. Even then Devadatta spoke as before.

analyzed: kha cig gis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: some generated the mind of the pratyekabuddha enlightenment,

analyzed: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu / kha cig gis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /

original: kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu /

original: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu /

analyzed: kha cig gis ni rab tu byung nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te dgra bcom par gyur /

original: kha cig gis ni sangs rgyas la skyabs su song //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni sangs rgyas la skyabs su song //

original: kha cig gis ni chos la /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni chos la /
translated: some in the Dharma,

original: kha cig gis ni dge 'dun la ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni dge 'dun la ste /

original: 'khor de dag kyang phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol //
analyzed: 'khor de dag kyang phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol //

original: chos la 'bab /
analyzed: chos la 'bab /
translated: in devotion to the Dharma,

original: dge 'dun la 'bab par bkod do //
analyzed: dge 'dun la 'bab par bkod do //
translated: and in devotion to the Saṅgha.

original: de nas rgyal po zas gtsang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po zas gtsang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then King Śuddhodana thought,

analyzed: sngon ni bcom ldan 'das lha dang lha ma yin gyi 'gro bar @142b bcas pas mchod pa dang brjed pa dag /

analyzed: de nas sh'akya gzhon nu zhig gis tshigs su bcad de gsol pa //

analyzed: drang srong chen po smra mchog dam chos kyis //
translated: “Great Sage, supreme speaker, with the true Dharma,

analyzed: char pas 'gro ba 'di ni tshim mdzad de //

original: mi bzad lam du ltung ba'i 'jig rten 'di //
analyzed: mi bzad lam du ltung ba'i 'jig rten 'di //

analyzed: drongs te thar pa'i lam la sbyar bar mdzod //
translated: lead it and establish it on the path of liberation.”

analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang ni 'di snyam du bdag gi bu 'ba' zhig 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing 'di ltar mthu che ba yin no snyam ste /
translated: King Śuddhodana thought, “My son alone has such great magical power and such great might.”

analyzed: lhag par dga' bas bden pa mthong ngo //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa //

analyzed: lhag par dga' ba las gyur gyis mdor na de'i dregs pa spong du gzhug go /

analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis bden pa mthong bar mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: ha cang zhum pa dang / shin tu dga' ba'o //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: mo'u dgal gyi bu rgyal po zas gtsang la soms shig /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana, think of King Śuddhodana.”

translated: “Yes, Bhadanta,” the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana replied,

original: 'ong ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'ong ba mthong ngo //

original: mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po khyod byon pa legs so //
analyzed: mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po khyod byon pa legs so //
translated: Welcome, Mahā­maudgalyāyana!

original: btsun pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs shig /
analyzed: btsun pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs shig /
translated: Bhadanta Mahā­maudgalyāyana, please sit on the prepared seat.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go /
translated: The venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana sat down on the seat that had been prepared for him.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos sems ji ltar mnyam par gzhag na rang gi stan las mi snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos sems ji ltar mnyam par gzhag na rang gi stan las mi snang bar gyur te /
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, with his mind in meditative equipoise, disappeared from his seat

original: shar phyogs kyi steng gi bar snang la mngon par 'phags nas spyod lam rnam pa bzhi byed de /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi steng gi bar snang la mngon par 'phags nas spyod lam rnam pa bzhi byed de /
translated: and rose up into the sky above in the east, where he performed the four types of magical displays.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They were as follows:

analyzed: 'chag pa dang 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal bar byed do //

analyzed: me'i ting nge 'dzin la yang snyoms par 'jug par byed do //

original: me'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
analyzed: me'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa na /
translated: When he entered the meditative absorption of fire,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mo'u gal gyi bu chen po'i lus las 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs dag 'byin par byed de /
translated: the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana emitted various kinds of light from his body.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel gyi kha dog dag go /
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, orange, and crystal-colored.

analyzed: cho 'phrul zung du yang ston par byed de //
translated: He also performed the double miracle.

original: lus kyi smad nas me 'bar bar byed la //
analyzed: lus kyi smad nas me 'bar bar byed la //
translated: From the lower part of his body he emitted flames,

original: lus kyi stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bebs par byed do //
translated: and from the upper part he emitted cold water.

original: lus kyi stod nas me 'bar bar byed la //
analyzed: lus kyi stod nas me 'bar bar byed la //
translated: From the upper part of his body he emitted flames,

analyzed: lus kyi smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bebs par byed pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: and from the lower part he emitted cold water.

analyzed: shar phyogs la ji lta ba bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs su yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as in the east, so also in the south, west, and north.

analyzed: phyogs bzhir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam @143b pa bzhi bstan nas //

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par 'du byas pa bsdus te /
translated: he withdrew the miraculous performance.

original: gdan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go /
analyzed: gdan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go /

original: grong khyer ser skya'i gzhir dril sgrogs su bcug pa /
analyzed: grong khyer ser skya'i gzhir dril sgrogs su bcug pa /
translated: and had it proclaimed with a gong in the city of Kapilavastu:

original: grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi na gnas pa'i shes ldan dag nyon cig /
analyzed: grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi na gnas pa'i shes ldan dag nyon cig /
translated: “Sages living in the city of Kapilavastu, listen!

original: bzang ldan dang / nam gru dang / ma 'gags pa dang / lhas byin la sogs te /
analyzed: bzang ldan dang / nam gru dang / ma 'gags pa dang / lhas byin la sogs te /
translated: Bhadrika, Revata, Aniruddha, Devadatta, and so on.

original: sh'akya lnga brgya rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: sh'akya lnga brgya rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur gyis /
translated: Five hundred Śākyas will go forth.

original: thos par gyis la rab tu dga' ba bskyed cig /
analyzed: thos par gyis la rab tu dga' ba bskyed cig /
translated: Listen to this and give rise to joy.

original: ces bsgo'o // lhas byin gyis de thos nas sdug bsngal chen po dang / yid mi bde ba skyes nas /
analyzed: ces bsgo'o // lhas byin gyis de thos nas sdug bsngal chen po dang / yid mi bde ba skyes nas /
translated: When Devadatta heard this, he was filled with great suffering and unhappiness.

original: gal te bdag gis sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan nges par rab tu 'byung bar shes par gyur dang / bdag khas len par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan nges par rab tu 'byung bar shes par gyur dang / bdag khas len par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: “If I had known that the Śākya king Bhadrika would definitely go forth, I would not have agreed.

original: da ni gal te rab tu ma byung na brdzun du smra ba yin no zhes rgyal srid kyang thob par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: da ni gal te rab tu ma byung na brdzun du smra ba yin no zhes rgyal srid kyang thob par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Now, if I do not go forth, I will be a liar.” Thinking this, he realized that he would not obtain the kingdom.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du dus 'dir zad dam cis rab tu byung la bdag rab tu 'byung bzhin du rgyal srid bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du dus 'dir zad dam cis rab tu byung la bdag rab tu 'byung bzhin du rgyal srid bya'o snyam mo //
translated: “Everything is finished. Why should I not go forth? I will obtain the kingdom while I am going forth.”🔽Then King Śuddhodana thought this:

original: de nas rgyal po zas gtsang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po zas gtsang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then King Śuddhodana thought this:

original: sh'akya rnams kyi tha ma'i 'byor pa la blta'o snyam nas /
analyzed: sh'akya rnams kyi tha ma'i 'byor pa la blta'o snyam nas /
translated: Let us see the Sakyas' last display of wealth.

original: des grong khyer de gseg ma dang gyo mo bsal /
analyzed: des grong khyer de gseg ma dang gyo mo bsal /
translated: He had the city cleared of pebbles and gravel,

original: tsan dan gyi chus chag chag btab /
analyzed: tsan dan gyi chus chag chag btab /
translated: sprinkled with sandalwood water,

original: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan bsgreng /
analyzed: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan bsgreng /
translated: raised parasols and banners,

original: dar gyi chun 'phyangs mang po dbyangs /
analyzed: dar gyi chun 'phyangs mang po dbyangs /
translated: hung many silk tassels,

original: shin tu dri zhim po'i phog phor nye bar bzhag /
analyzed: shin tu dri zhim po'i phog phor nye bar bzhag /
translated: placed fragrant censers,

original: me tog sna tshogs kyi sil mas dga' dga' ldan byed du bcug go //
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs kyi sil mas dga' dga' ldan byed du bcug go //
translated: and had it filled with the joy of various flower petals.

original: de nas sh'akya brgya stong phrag du mas yongs su @151a *//
analyzed: de nas sh'akya brgya stong phrag du mas yongs su @151a *//
translated: Then, surrounded by hundreds of thousands of Sakyas,

original: bskor nas grong khyer gyi sgo na sengge'i khri la 'dug go /
analyzed: bskor nas grong khyer gyi sgo na sengge'i khri la 'dug go /
translated: he sat on a lion throne at the city gate.

original: sh'akya mo dang sh'akya gzhon nu ma ngo mtshar skyes pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: sh'akya mo dang sh'akya gzhon nu ma ngo mtshar skyes pa rnams kyang /
translated: The Sakya women and young Sakyas who were amazed

original: skar khung khol ma can dang / skar khung dang / stegs bu dag la 'dug go /
analyzed: skar khung khol ma can dang / skar khung dang / stegs bu dag la 'dug go /
translated: sat in the windows, in the skylights, and on the balconies.

original: sh'akya rnams kyi 'byor pa la lta bar 'dod pa'i skye bo'i tshogs yul sna tshogs nas lhags pa dag kyang lam po che dang / tshong 'dus dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo rnams su 'dug go /
analyzed: sh'akya rnams kyi 'byor pa la lta bar 'dod pa'i skye bo'i tshogs yul sna tshogs nas lhags pa dag kyang lam po che dang / tshong 'dus dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo rnams su 'dug go /
translated: A crowd of people who wanted to see the Sakyas’ wealth gathered in the streets, markets, crossroads, and intersections.

original: sh'akya las su dag gis ni mnyes par 'gyur //
analyzed: sh'akya las su dag gis ni mnyes par 'gyur //
translated: “Who among the Sakyas will please him?🔽Who will displease him?”

original: su dag gis ni thugs byung bar 'gyur ba brtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: su dag gis ni thugs byung bar 'gyur ba brtag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to find out,

original: bram ze mtshan mkhan dang / ltas mkhan dag pa bkug go /
analyzed: bram ze mtshan mkhan dang / ltas mkhan dag pa bkug go /
translated: they summoned brahmins who were skilled in interpreting signs and omens.

original: sh'akya rnams do shal dang / gdu bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / rgyan gyis brgyan pa rnams kyis pha dang ma dag las bltas nas so so'i shing rtar zhugs te phyir 'byung bar brtsams pa na /
analyzed: sh'akya rnams do shal dang / gdu bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / rgyan gyis brgyan pa rnams kyis pha dang ma dag las bltas nas so so'i shing rtar zhugs te phyir 'byung bar brtsams pa na /
translated: The Sakyas, adorned with necklaces, bracelets, armlets, and ornaments, looked at their parents and then set out in their individual chariots.

original: sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan sna la byung ba /🔽mtshan mkhan rnams kyis mthong nas /
analyzed: sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan sna la byung ba / mtshan mkhan rnams kyis mthong nas /
translated: As they were leaving, the Sakyan king Bhadraka came by.🔽The interpreters of signs saw him

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: and said,

original: re zhig 'dis ni mnyes par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re zhig 'dis ni mnyes par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: “He will please him.”

original: de bzhin du nam gru dang / ma 'gags pa la sogs pa phyir byung ba dang / de rnams kyang mtshan mkhan rnams kyis lung bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du nam gru dang / ma 'gags pa la sogs pa phyir byung ba dang / de rnams kyang mtshan mkhan rnams kyis lung bstan to //
translated: Likewise, Revata, Aniruddha, and so on, were expelled.

original: de nas lhas byin phyir byung ste /
analyzed: de nas lhas byin phyir byung ste /
translated: Then Devadatta was expelled.

original: de phyir byung ba na bya khras gtsug gi nor bu phrogs pa mtshan mkhan rnams kyis mthong nas de rnams kyis smras pa; 'di'i rtags dang sbyar na gdon mi za bar ston pa la 'khus nas dmyal bar gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyir byung ba na bya khras gtsug gi nor bu phrogs pa mtshan mkhan rnams kyis mthong nas de rnams kyis smras pa; 'di'i rtags dang sbyar na gdon mi za bar ston pa la 'khus nas dmyal bar gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he was expelled, a bird stole his crest jewel. The astrologers saw this and said, “According to the signs, he will certainly slander the Teacher and go to hell.”

original: ko ka li ka dang / khan dra ba bya dang / ka ta mo ra ka ti sha dang / rgya mtshos byin rnams phyir 'byung ba @151b na bong bu'i skad grag nas /
analyzed: ko ka li ka dang / khan dra ba bya dang / ka ta mo ra ka ti sha dang / rgya mtshos byin rnams phyir 'byung ba @151b na bong bu'i skad grag nas /
translated: Kokālika, Kaṭamorakatiṣya, and Sāgara were expelled.

original: de dag kyang mtshan mkhan rnams kyis lung bstan pa /
analyzed: de dag kyang mtshan mkhan rnams kyis lung bstan pa /
translated: The astrologers predicted,

original: 'di dag gis kyang nyan thos chen po rnams la tshig ngan pa smras nas dmyal bar gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis kyang nyan thos chen po rnams la tshig ngan pa smras nas dmyal bar gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “They will also go to hell after speaking harshly to the great disciples.”

original: nye dga' glang po che la zhon pas phan tshun du lta bar byed pa na /
analyzed: nye dga' glang po che la zhon pas phan tshun du lta bar byed pa na /
translated: Udayin, riding an elephant, was looking around.

original: mu tig gi do shal lhung ba dang / de glang po che las babs te blangs so //
analyzed: mu tig gi do shal lhung ba dang / de glang po che las babs te blangs so //
translated: When his pearl necklace fell off, he got down from the elephant and picked it up.

original: de yang de rnams kyis lung bstan pa /
analyzed: de yang de rnams kyis lung bstan pa /
translated: They also prophesied about him:

original: 'di ha cang 'dod chen ches pas sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ha cang 'dod chen ches pas sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Because of his excessive greed, he will be reborn in the hells.”

original: de nas bzang ldan dang / nam gru dang / ma 'gags pa dang / lha sbyin la sogs pa sh'akya lnga brgya po de rnams skyed mos tshal du dus ston la 'gro ba bzhin du bzang pos 'gran cing bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ngo //
analyzed: de nas bzang ldan dang / nam gru dang / ma 'gags pa dang / lha sbyin la sogs pa sh'akya lnga brgya po de rnams skyed mos tshal du dus ston la 'gro ba bzhin du bzang pos 'gran cing bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong ngo //
translated: Then Bhadrika, Revata, Aniruddha, Devadatta, and the other five hundred Śākyas, like people going to a festival in a pleasure grove, went to the Blessed One, competing with Bhadrika.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: The Blessed One thought,

original: gal te ngas sh'akya rnams la dge slong tshur shog ces bya bas rab tu phyung na /🔽kha cig gis ni mnyes par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te ngas sh'akya rnams la dge slong tshur shog ces bya bas rab tu phyung na / kha cig gis ni mnyes par byed par 'gyur /
translated: “If I give the going forth to the Śākyas with ‘Come, monk,’🔽some will be pleased,

original: kha cig gis ni mnyes par byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni mnyes par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: but some will not be pleased.

original: mnyes par byed par mi 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag gzhan du sems la /
analyzed: mnyes par byed par mi 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag gzhan du sems la /
translated: Those who are not pleased will think otherwise.

original: dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba ni thams cad srid pa tha ma yin pas ma la ngas thams cad dge slong rnams kyis gsol pa dang bzhi'i las kyis rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs su gzhug go snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba ni thams cad srid pa tha ma yin pas ma la ngas thams cad dge slong rnams kyis gsol pa dang bzhi'i las kyis rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs su gzhug go snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: “Come, monks!” means that since all of them were in their last existence, I thought, “I will have all of them go forth and be fully ordained through the four-part formal procedure of request and invitation.”

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag ser skya'i gzhi'i sh'akya rnams gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par gyis shig /
analyzed: dge slong dag ser skya'i gzhi'i sh'akya rnams gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis rab tu 'byung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs par gyis shig /
translated: “Monks, have the Śākyas of Kapilavastu go forth and be fully ordained through the four-part formal procedure of request and invitation.”

original: btsun pa bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes dge slong de rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das las mnyan to //
analyzed: btsun pa bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes dge slong de rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das las mnyan to //
translated: “Venerable Sir, as you say,” the monks replied, and they did as the Blessed One had instructed.

original: rgyal @152a *// po zas gtsang gis sh'akya rnams kyi 'dreg mkhan nye bar 'khor zhes bya ba de rnams rab tu 'byin pa na /
analyzed: rgyal @152a *// po zas gtsang gis sh'akya rnams kyi 'dreg mkhan nye bar 'khor zhes bya ba de rnams rab tu 'byin pa na /
translated: King Śuddhodana sent the barber Upatiṣya, who was a Śākya, to have them go forth.

original: skra 'dreg par btang nas /
analyzed: skra 'dreg par btang nas /
translated: He was sent to shave their hair.

original: sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan gyi skra 'dreg pa na /
analyzed: sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan gyi skra 'dreg pa na /
translated: When the Śākya king Bhadra was shaving his head,

original: de ngom zug gnag cing mchi ma 'dzag la skad 'dzer cing dbugs brdzangs por skra 'dreg par byed do //
analyzed: de ngom zug gnag cing mchi ma 'dzag la skad 'dzer cing dbugs brdzangs por skra 'dreg par byed do //
translated: he shaved it with a sorrowful face, shedding tears, his voice choked and his breath labored.

original: sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan gyis smras pa /
translated: The Śākya king Bhadra said,

original: nye bar 'khor ci'i phyir ngu /
analyzed: nye bar 'khor ci'i phyir ngu /
translated: “Upatiṣya, why are you crying?”

original: de snying rje rje skad du gcom chung ngur dal bus tshig re nas smras pa /
analyzed: de snying rje rje skad du gcom chung ngur dal bus tshig re nas smras pa /
translated: He said in a pitiful voice, softly and slowly,

original: lha bdag 'dzam bu'i gling gi skyes bu gtso bo rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyid bgyid pa /
analyzed: lha bdag 'dzam bu'i gling gi skyes bu gtso bo rnams la bsnyen bkur bgyid bgyid pa /
translated: “Your Majesty, I have served the foremost people of Jambudvīpa

original: mi phal pa rnams la yang bsnyen bkur bgyid pa 'gyur ba lta zhig /
analyzed: mi phal pa rnams la yang bsnyen bkur bgyid pa 'gyur ba lta zhig /
translated: and have also served ordinary people.

original: khyed kyis spangs te gson pas ni gum mi bsngo'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis spangs te gson pas ni gum mi bsngo'o //
translated: I will not be able to serve them again after I have died.”

original: sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan gyis smras pa /
translated: The Śākya king Bhadra said,

original: nye bar 'khor khyod kyis jo bo la snying nye ba'i mnyes par bya ba bstan zin te chog gis mya ngan ma byed cig /
analyzed: nye bar 'khor khyod kyis jo bo la snying nye ba'i mnyes par bya ba bstan zin te chog gis mya ngan ma byed cig /
translated: “Upatiṣya, you have shown your love for your master. That is enough. Do not grieve.”

original: ngas ci lta mi phal pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o zhes smras nas /
analyzed: ngas ci lta mi phal pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o zhes smras nas /
translated: “I will do whatever it takes to not serve the common people.”

original: des phyogs gcig tu ras shig bting nas sh'akya gzhon nu rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: des phyogs gcig tu ras shig bting nas sh'akya gzhon nu rnams la smras pa /
translated: He spread out a cloth in one place and said to the young Śākyas,

original: shes ldan gzhon nu dag nyon cig /
analyzed: shes ldan gzhon nu dag nyon cig /
translated: “Sirs, listen!

original: 'dreg mkhan nye bar 'khor 'dis bdag cag la bkur sti byas la bdag cag kyang slar khyim du mi gnas kyis /
analyzed: 'dreg mkhan nye bar 'khor 'dis bdag cag la bkur sti byas la bdag cag kyang slar khyim du mi gnas kyis /
translated: This barber Upatiṣya has served us, but we have not served him in return.

original: rgyan rnams de'i 'tsho ba'i rkyen du ras kyi steng du zhog cig /
analyzed: rgyan rnams de'i 'tsho ba'i rkyen du ras kyi steng du zhog cig /
translated: So put your jewelry on the cloth as a condition for his livelihood.”

original: de rnams kyi se mo do dang do shal dang mgul rgyan dang / gdu bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / rna cha la sogs pa rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyi se mo do dang do shal dang mgul rgyan dang / gdu bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / rna cha la sogs pa rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
translated: They put their bracelets, necklaces, earrings, armlets, and other ornaments made of various precious substances

original: rgyan khyad par can rnams kyis ras kyi steng du phung po chen por spungs so //
analyzed: rgyan khyad par can rnams kyis ras kyi steng du phung po chen por spungs so //
translated: on the cloth in a great heap.

original: nye bar 'khor gyis de rnams @152b mthar gyis skra bregs te /
analyzed: nye bar 'khor gyis de rnams @152b mthar gyis skra bregs te /
translated: Upatiṣya shaved their heads in order.

original: de rnams khrus la dong ba dang / des bsams pa /
analyzed: de rnams khrus la dong ba dang / des bsams pa /
translated: When they went to bathe, he thought,🔽“

original: re zhig gzhon nu 'di dag rigs dang / 'byor pa dang / lang tsho la bab cing chung ma dang ldan la mdzod dang bang mdzod kyis rgyas pa yang spangs nas rab tu 'byung na /
analyzed: re zhig gzhon nu 'di dag rigs dang / 'byor pa dang / lang tsho la bab cing chung ma dang ldan la mdzod dang bang mdzod kyis rgyas pa yang spangs nas rab tu 'byung na /
translated: “These young men, who are of good family, wealthy, in the prime of life, and have wives and are endowed with treasuries and storehouses, have given all that up and gone forth.

original: bdag rgyan 'di tsam la chags pa ni tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag rgyan 'di tsam la chags pa ni tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If I, attached to just this much jewelry, were to die, that would not be right. I would suffer.”

original: gal te bdag rigs ngan du ma skyes na /
analyzed: gal te bdag rigs ngan du ma skyes na /
translated: “If only I had not been born into a low caste!

original: bdag kyang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung zhing chu bo las rgal ba dang / sbyor ba las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir brtsal ba dang / 'bad pa la brtson par bya ba zhig snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag kyang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung zhing chu bo las rgal ba dang / sbyor ba las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir brtsal ba dang / 'bad pa la brtson par bya ba zhig snyam mo //
translated: If only I could go forth into the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya and strive, persevere, and make efforts to cross the flood and go beyond bondage.”

original: 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: This is the way it is:

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs pa de bzhin du nyan thos chen po rnams kyang byed pas /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs pa de bzhin du nyan thos chen po rnams kyang byed pas /
translated: Just as the blessed buddhas look out over the world three times each day and three times each night with their buddha eyes, so too do the great hearers.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'dreg mkhan nye bar 'khor lhag par skyo ba skyes pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'dreg mkhan nye bar 'khor lhag par skyo ba skyes pa mthong ngo //
translated: The Venerable Śāriputra saw that Upāli the barber was especially sad.

original: mthong nas kyang 'dreg mkhan nye bar 'khor gang na bder song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang 'dreg mkhan nye bar 'khor gang na bder song ste phyin nas /
translated: Having seen that, he went to where Upāli the barber was and,

original: 'dreg mkhan nye bar 'khor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: 'dreg mkhan nye bar 'khor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: having arrived, said this to Upāli the barber:

original: nye bar 'khor khyod ci'i phyir shin tu mi dga' bas lag pa 'gram pa la gtad nas sems khong du chud cing 'dug /
analyzed: nye bar 'khor khyod ci'i phyir shin tu mi dga' bas lag pa 'gram pa la gtad nas sems khong du chud cing 'dug /
translated: “Upāli, why are you sitting here with your hand on your cheek, unhappy and sad?”

original: nye bar 'khor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: nye bar 'khor gyis smras pa /
translated: Upāli said,

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gang gi phyir da ltar gzhon nu 'di dag rigs dang / 'byor pa dang / lang tsho la bab cing chung ma dang ldan la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar gzhon nu 'di dag rigs dang / 'byor pa dang / lang tsho la bab cing chung ma dang ldan la /
translated: because these young men, who are now in their prime, with wives,

original: mdzod dang bang mdzod kyis rgyas pa yang spangs nas rab tu 'byung na /
analyzed: mdzod dang bang mdzod kyis rgyas pa yang spangs nas rab tu 'byung na /
translated: and with full treasuries and storehouses, have renounced all that and gone forth,

original: bdag rgyan 'di tsam la chags pa @153a *//
analyzed: bdag rgyan 'di tsam la chags pa @153a *//
translated: I am attached to these ornaments

original: ni tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ni tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nyi ma'i 'od zer rnon pos gdungs nas grib ma'i ched du phyogs der son pa @155b na de'i glu'i sgra thos nas tshigs su bcad nas smras pa / steng nas nyi mas gdungs byed cing //

analyzed: ci'i phyir nyi ma'i gdungs pa med; ;mdzes dags kyang tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
